head.title: Battered Body of Newborn Found After Being Hit by Several Vehicles

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: Battered Body of Newborn Found After Being Hit by Several Vehicles
hedline.hl2: Battered Body of Newborn Found After Being Hit by Several Vehicles

body.head.byline: By TIMOTHY WILLIAMS; Angela Macropoulos contributed reporting for this article.

abstract.p: Body of newborn is found in Hempstead, NY, after being struck by several vehicles whose drivers were apparently unaware of what they had run over; police are investigating; maps (M)

block.p: The body of a newborn was discovered on a quiet Long Island street yesterday morning after being struck by several vehicles whose drivers were apparently unaware of what they were running over, the police said.
The authorities had not found the child's mother as of last night, and local hospitals said the authorities had been checking for women who might have recently given birth.

The body of a newborn was discovered on a quiet Long Island street yesterday morning after being struck by several vehicles whose drivers were apparently unaware of what they were running over, the police said.

The body of a newborn was discovered on a quiet Long Island street yesterday morning after being struck by several vehicles whose drivers were apparently unaware of what they were running over, the police said.
The authorities had not found the child's mother as of last night, and local hospitals said the authorities had been checking for women who might have recently given birth.

The body, whose sex and race had not been determined, was found just after 7:30 a.m. on by a man walking his dog on Sunset Drive near Dicks Lane , according to Lt. Dennis Farrell of the Nassau County Police Department homicide squad.
The man originally thought the body was the remains of an animal that had been hit by vehicles after wandering into the street, Lieutenant Farrell said in a news release.
''Preliminary investigation determined that the newborn baby had been struck by several vehicles, and had been in the roadway for sometime,'' the release said.

Many questions remained late yesterday. It is unclear, for instance, how the newborn ended up in the street; whether the baby had died before or after its body was struck by vehicles; or how long the body had been in the street.
The neighborhood where the body was found is residential, with Tudor-style houses. The Hempstead Golf and Country Club is on the opposite side of Sunset Drive.
People who live nearby said they were unaware of what had happened until Nassau County police officers knocked on their doors yesterday morning.
''I love living in this neighborhood -- it's quiet,'' said Kim Daniels, who said her two children walk the family's dogs each morning where the body was found. ''I'm very shocked.''
Another neighbor who declined to give his name, said, ''This kind of thing doesn't happen here.''
The body was taken to the county medical examiner's office for further examination, the authorities said.
